data.title: Good for breakfast.
data.text: The Soup Shoppe is a very popular family run restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. The food is somewhat average, but filling an in a pleasant environment.

data.title: The 3 Soup Shoppe
data.text:
Only 3 soups on the menu.  Vegetable Beef tasted like 
vinegar. Turkey salad had no taste.  Won't be back.

data.title: Where's the beef?
data.text: We went in after several people telling us that it's a great sandwich shop. Even though there was only one other couple in the resturant our waitress seemed rushed. I have food allergies and asked a couple of questions and she seemed as if was bothersome to answer them. The resturant itself felt dirty, it really could use an update and good cleaning. My daughter got breakfast, my husband half a ham salad sandwich with barley soup and I opted for the  patty melt with a cup of turkey noodle soup. The breakfast was just okay, she actually didn't finish the eggs saying they were rubbery. My husband liked his, just mentioned a little saltey on the soup. I had to hunt for the beef on the sandwich, way too much butter used to grill the bread it fell apart and I ordered it with grilled onions and the waitress had to go back and bring them to me. They came in huge slices. The noodles in the soup were mushy, but it had good flavor. For a $8.50 sandwich I don't think I will return or recommend.

data.title: Welcome to my office...
data.text: I've been eating the majority of my breakfasts at this cozy little diner since December 2006.  This is the sort of place you go because you know the people...the owners, Reggie and Michelle; the staff, Kathy and Ana, and all the rest.  They learn quickly your specific breakfast quirks (there's always a little peanut butter to go with my pancakes), and they know I'm going to use all the cream for my coffee.  The Soup Shoppe is friendly and simple.  It's perfect for a breakfast meeting (of which I have a lot).  It's perfect for hanging out.  It's perfect for visiting with friends from the neighborhood.  The food isn't going to get them in the Michelin guidebook, but it's simple, basic, and ample without being piggish in proportion.  I love a good diner, and this little place is the best.

data.title: Vegetarian Club is awesome
data.text:
I had this sandwich on squaw bread.  OMG!  Delicious and huge. Loaded with sprouts, lettuce, cucumber, avocado, white and yellow cheeeses and tomato. I also had the lentil soup and it was good too.

Price was very fair too...I paid less than $10 for soup and sandwich.

I'm thinking about trying it out for breakfast before I head home to Seattle.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS QUAINT PLACE.

data.title: Love this Yummy little place
data.text: I found this place back in 2007 when i used to work at one of the medical office builidngs. I recently went  and Enjoyed breakfast. I usually like to get the two eggs breakfast or a bowl of oatmeal. I love the the poppyseed muffins there. There are baked and super yummy. I also like their pies and fresh brewed rasberry ice. The food here has the home cooked tatses that i crave.

data.title: Great Breakfast Spot
data.text:
This is the perfect old fashioned breakfast spot.  It is tucked away in a mall, but worth finding.

My eggs and bacon were perfect -- with great coffee.  

I want to come back and try the soup at lunch.
